Thank you for your contribution! To ensure a smooth and efficient review process,
please provide the information requested below. This helps align your contribution
with the project's standards and architectural vision.
-->

### PR Title Format
<!--
Please use a conventional commit message format for your PR title. This is critical for automated changelog generation and release management.

Examples:
- `feat: Add new watercolor brush style to sketching canvas`
- `fix: Correct color palette rendering issue on mobile Safari`
- `docs: Update README with advanced style customization options`
- `refactor: Optimize image generation API call`
- `ci: Add E2E tests for the new style transfer feature`
-->


### 1. Description of Change
<!--
Provide a clear and concise description of the changes introduced by this PR.
- **What problem does this solve?** (e.g., Users cannot erase parts of their sketch.)
- **What is the new behavior?** (e.g., An eraser tool has been added to the toolbar.)
- **Why is this change necessary?** (e.g., To improve the creative flexibility for users.)
-->



### 2. Related Issue
<!--
Link to the GitHub issue that this pull request resolves. This is mandatory for traceability.
- Use keywords like `Closes`, `Fixes`, or `Resolves` to automatically close the issue upon merge.
- Example: `Closes #123`
-->

Closes #

### 6. Pre-Submission Checklist
<!--
Go through all the following points and check the boxes. This checklist ensures your contribution meets our quality standards.
-->

- [ ] My code adheres to the style guidelines of this project (enforced by **Biome**).
- [ ] I have performed a thorough self-review of my own code.
- [ ] I have added comments to my code, particularly in complex or hard-to-understand areas.
- [ ] I have made corresponding changes to the documentation (`README.md`, etc.).
- [ ] My changes generate no new warnings or errors in the console.
- [ ] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works as intended.
- [ ] New and existing unit tests pass locally with my changes.
- [ ] Any dependent changes have been merged and published in downstream modules.
